description: News, updates and information for the Bailiwick of Guernsey.
title: Guernsey news and updates: 30 November
title_page: Guernsey news and updates: 30 November - 4 December - BBC News
maintext:
The UK's new point-based immigration system will not be replicated in Guernsey.
It means that after the Brexit transition period, those hoping to emigrate to the island will need a joint immigration and population management work permit.
In Guernsey, EU Nationals and those from the European Economic Area, will have to apply for a visa via the UK online system, on top of their local employment permit.
However, those who have already registered for the EU settlement scheme are exempt from needing to apply.
This differs from the UK's plans, which means to qualify for a visa, migrant workers who want to move to the UK will have to qualify for 70 points.
For example, having an offer from an approved employer for a skilled job will earn 40 points, being able to speak English will give another 10 points and they can also gain extra points for qualifications.
The States said plans were in place to engage with the local industries who attract workers to the island.
